Event.Message:
Domain Controller Blocked: NTLM authentication to this domain controller is blocked. Secure Channel name: %1 User name: %2 Domain name: %3 Workstation name: %4 Secure Channel type: %5
NTLM authentication within the domain %3 is blocked.
If you want to allow NTLM authentication requests in the domain %3, set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: NTLM authentication in this domain to Disabled.
If you want to allow NTLM authentication requests only to specific servers in the domain %3, set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: NTLM authentication in this domain to Deny for domain servers or Deny domain accounts to domain servers, and then set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: Add server exceptions in this domain to define a list of servers in this domain as an exception to use NTLM authentication.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="SChannelName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="UserName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="DomainName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="WorkstationName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SChannelType" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> </template>

Event.Message:
Domain Controller Blocked: NTLM authentication to this domain controller is blocked. Secure Channel name: %1 User name: %2 Domain name: %3 Workstation name: %4 Secure Channel type: %5
NTLM authentication within the domain %3 is blocked.
If you want to allow NTLM authentication requests in the domain %3, set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: NTLM authentication in this domain to Disabled.
If you want to allow NTLM authentication requests only to specific servers in the domain %3, set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: NTLM authentication in this domain to Deny for domain servers or Deny domain accounts to domain servers, and then set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: Add server exceptions in this domain to define a list of servers in this domain as an exception to use NTLM authentication.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="SChannelName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="UserName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="DomainName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="WorkstationName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SChannelType" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> </template>

Event.Message:
Domain Controller Blocked: NTLM authentication to this domain controller is blocked. Secure Channel name: %1 User name: %2 Domain name: %3 Workstation name: %4 Secure Channel type: %5
NTLM authentication within the domain %3 is blocked.
If you want to allow NTLM authentication requests in the domain %3, set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: NTLM authentication in this domain to Disabled.
If you want to allow NTLM authentication requests only to specific servers in the domain %3, set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: NTLM authentication in this domain to Deny for domain servers or Deny domain accounts to domain servers, and then set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: Add server exceptions in this domain to define a list of servers in this domain as an exception to use NTLM authentication.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="SChannelName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="UserName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="DomainName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="WorkstationName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SChannelType" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> </template>

Event.Message:
Domain Controller Blocked Audit: Audit NTLM authentication to this domain controller. Secure Channel name: %1 User name: %2 Domain name: %3 Workstation name: %4 Secure Channel type: %5
Audit NTLM authentication requests within the domain %3 that would be blocked if the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: NTLM authentication in this domain is set to any of the Deny options.
If you want to allow NTLM authentication requests in the domain %3, set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: NTLM authentication in this domain to Disabled.
If you want to allow NTLM authentication requests to specific servers in the domain %3, set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: NTLM authentication in this domain to Deny for domain servers or Deny domain accounts to domain servers, and then set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: Add server exceptions in this domain to define a list of servers in the domain %3 to which clients are allowed to use NTLM authentication.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="SChannelName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="UserName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="DomainName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="WorkstationName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SChannelType" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> </template>

Event.Message:
Domain Controller Blocked Audit: Audit NTLM authentication to this domain controller. Secure Channel name: %1 User name: %2 Domain name: %3 Workstation name: %4 Secure Channel type: %5
Audit NTLM authentication requests within the domain %3 that would be blocked if the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: NTLM authentication in this domain is set to any of the Deny options.
If you want to allow NTLM authentication requests in the domain %3, set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: NTLM authentication in this domain to Disabled.
If you want to allow NTLM authentication requests to specific servers in the domain %3, set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: NTLM authentication in this domain to Deny for domain servers or Deny domain accounts to domain servers, and then set the security policy Network Security: Restrict NTLM: Add server exceptions in this domain to define a list of servers in the domain %3 to which clients are allowed to use NTLM authentication.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="SChannelName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="UserName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="DomainName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="WorkstationName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SChannelType" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> </template>

Event.Message: Netlogon failed to retrieve the password for account %1 in domain %2. %3
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="AccountName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="AccountDomain" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="Status" inType="win:UInt32" outType="win:NTStatus"/> </template>

Event.Message: The account %1 cannot be used as managed service account on the local machine because not all the supported encryption types of the account are supported by the local machine.
Netlogon failed to add %1 as a managed service account to this local machine. %2
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="Account" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="Status" inType="win:UInt32" outType="win:NTStatus"/> </template>

Event.Message: Netlogon failed to remove the managed service account %1 from this local machine. %2
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="Account" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="Status" inType="win:UInt32" outType="win:NTStatus"/> </template>
